newsitem.title: UK: UK physical grain market quiet and easier.
newsitem.headline: UK physical grain market quiet and easier.

text.p: UK physical grain trading was almost at a standstill on Wednesday with many traders feeling this could be the finish until after the Christmas, New Year break.
"It's not looking good, people are too busy doing administration work or visiting their customers to do fresh business," said a trader.
Traders said the only possible excitement in the market could be Thursday's European Union tender, but they half expected it to be a non-event.
"I can't see the Commission doing much on Thursday, they may try and tease us a bit, but at the end of the day I think it will be a damp squib," said another trader.
In light trading feed wheat traded at 100.50 stg a tonne for March fob ex-east coast ports.
Buyers were seeking February feed wheat at 99.75 stg with sellers around 100 stg. Apr/Jun was offered at 102 stg with a bid of 101.50 against it.
Delivered traded levels were around 0.50 stg down with 99 stg paid for feed wheat in Tilbury and 98.50 stg in the Avon six range.
Feed barley fetched 100.50 stg a tonne on the south coast while 98.50 stg was paid in Bridgewater.
There were no reported trades for milling wheat.
